intro: Ononis cristata var. biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered sweet vernalgrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
